Message:
I don’t have the power
to make people smile...
It only makes sense, I guess.

No matter how much
I copy the great Cordie,
it’s not like I can ever be her.

Liftin’ my head after a spell,
I noticed a girl was watchin’ me.

Her eyes had lost
any trace of emotion...
just like my eyes had back then...

After meetin’ the great Cordie,
the once dark world around me
seemed to gain new light.

“You probably have a knack for
making people smile, y’know.”

I wasn’t smilin’ one bit.
If I look this unsure of myself,
nobody’s gonna wanna watch.

If I wanna reel ’em in,
I’ve gotta put a smile
on my own face first.
’Cause that’s how
the great Cordie’s smile got me!

“Come one, come all!
The travelin’ gunslinger
Flack’s show is about to begin!”

I continued performin’ my show.
Everyone kept on
walkin’ past me,
but I made sure to keep a smile
on my face just the same.

But while I performed,
the girl from before
walked up to watch me.
Just like I did that day...

“Get ready,
’cause these next tricks
are gonna be even flashier!”

When I shot her a smile,
light returned to her vacant eyes.
And...
